subject: Productivity
title: Decision Fatigue
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Decision Fatigue.

hook.text: By evening, even choosing what to eat for dinner feels exhausting. Your decision tank is empty.

buildup.text: Every choice depletes a shared mental resource. The more decisions you make, the worse they get.

discovery.text: Baumeister's studies showed judges granted parole at 65% early in the day but nearly 0% by afternoon.

twist.text: Decision fatigue doesn't just lower quality. It leads to avoidance â€” choosing not to choose.

climax.text: Automating routine decisions and scheduling big choices for the morning protects your best thinking.

punchline.text: Make the big calls early. Save the easy ones for later.

quiz.question: What happens to decision quality as the day progresses?
options: It declines as mental resources deplete
It stays constant throughout the day
